publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3141 Mr Adam Ingram: Larkhall to Milngavie Rail Line—That the Parliament notes the comments of South Lanarkshire councillor David McLachlan, vice-convener of Strathclyde Passenger Transport (SPT), in relation to the Larkhall to Milngavie rail line that "all we need is the Parliament to give us the power to head up the project", and calls on the Scottish Executive to make a decision over whether the British Railways (No.3) Order Confirmation Act 1994 can be transferred to SPT or whether a new Bill needs to be introduced into the Parliament to allow for this link, which is vital to the future economic prosperity of Larkhall, Stonehouse and Leshmahagow, to be progressed.
S1M-3141 Larkhall to Milngavie Rail Line (lodged on 22 May 2002) Michael Matheson*
